findings.title: Unprotected constructor
findings.description: The constructor of MBCAuth contract is public and unprotected, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: Smart contract owner can lock or unlock the contract permissions.

findings.title: Unsecured external function calls
findings.description: The functions addLiquidity, addLiquidityETH, swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens, and swapExactETHForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens have unsecured external function calls.

findings.title: Lack of input validation
findings.description: The smart contract has a low severity issue which may or may not create any functional vulnerability due to lack of input validation.

findings.title: Unprotected approval functions
findings.description: The approve function allows unlimited approvals without proper validation, potentially leading to unauthorized token transfers.

findings.title: Unsecured transfer and transferFrom functions
findings.description: The smart contract owner can manipulate transactions by blacklisting wallets, freezing contracts, or changing transaction fees and max hold percentages.

findings.title: Unprotected fee-taking mechanism
findings.description: The smart contract owner can change transaction fees without any restrictions or access control.

findings.title: Unsecured swapBack function
findings.description: The swapBack function is unsecured and can be exploited.

findings.title: Unprotected launch function
findings.description: The launch function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of the contract's state.

findings.title: Unsecured freeze function
findings.description: The freeze function is unsecured and can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Unsecured setIsDividendExempt, setIsFeeExempt, setIsMaxHoldExempt, and setIsTxLimitExempt functions
findings.description: The setIsDividendExempt, setIsFeeExempt, setIsMaxHoldExempt, and setIsTxLimitExempt functions are unsecured, potentially allowing unauthorized access or manipulation.
